newsitem.title: IRAQ: Iraq says people killed in US attack on Baghdad.
newsitem.headline: Iraq says people killed in US attack on Baghdad.

text.p: Iraq said U.S. missiles hit military bases and civilian areas in the capital Baghdad on Wednesday evening, killing a number of people.

"At 8.45 p.m. the American enemy directed its failing missiles against our military bases and civilian places and a number of them have fallen in Baghdad," Iraqi state television reported, quoting a statement by the general command of the Iraqi armed forces.

Earlier in Washington the Pentagon denied it had launched any attack against the Iraqi capital. Residents in Baghdad heard several large explosions, as well as anti-aircraft fire, but did not know what had caused them. Air-raid sirens sounded.
The Iraqi military statement said a number of people were killed in the attacks but did not say how many.
The statement called U.S. President Bill Clinton a "war criminal".
Iraqi air defence were able to shoot down many of the missiles, the statement said.

State television showed pictures of a building which it said was destroyed in the attack and a crater in a road in a residential area. Government officials said they would take reporters in Baghdad to see the damage.
Clinton, speaking to reporters in Washington shortly after reports of explosions in Baghdad, denied the United States had launched attacks against the capital.
Clinton said U.S. forces had nothing to do with explosions and anti-aircraft fire reported in Baghdad on Wednesday evening. "They are not the result of any action that we have taken," he said.

The United States said it launched a total of 44 cruise missiles against military targets in southern Iraq early on Tuesday and on Wednesday morning following Iraq's military incursion against areas of Kurdish-held northern Iraq at the weekend.
